title: Oregon Pinot Noir Tasting
description:
Join us on Wednesday, July 16, from 4–7 PM at Whispering Vine South Creek for a tasting that highlights the elegance, complexity, and regional character of Oregon Pinot Noir. Featuring four top-rated selections from the Willamette Valley and beyond, this is a must for lovers of cool-climate reds.

Tasting Fee: $30 (Buy a bottle from the tasting and your fee is refunded)

Featured Wines:

• Hyland Estates Coury Pinot Noir 2019 – 93 pts, Wine Spectator. Supple and layered with raspberry, cherry blossom, and toasty cinnamon on a lingering finish.

• Roserock by Drouhin Oregon Pinot Noir 2022 – 94 pts, Wine Spectator. Elegant and structured with raspberry, stony mineral, savory tea, and fine-grained tannins.

• Resonance Willamette Valley Pinot Noir 2022 – 94 pts, Wine Spectator. Precise and refined with raspberry, crushed stone, and savory tea layered over sleek acidity.

• Purple Hands Lone Oak Pinot Noir 2023 – 93 pts, Wine Spectator. Rich and expressive with raspberry, guava, black tea, and spice leading to a sculpted finish.

Explore the beauty of Oregon Pinot at its finest—buy a bottle and your tasting is free.
